item.title: Background for Shahana Hanif
item.description: Council Member Shahana Hanif has been one of the Council’s most outspoken advocates for safer streets. She consistently fights to redesign dangerous roads and slow down cars. Hanif believes no pedestrian or cyclist should fear for their life on city streets. When crashes happen, she shows up, demands action, and follows through. From pushing for protected bike lanes to championing lower speed limits, her record is clear. She stands firmly on the side of vulnerable road users, working to put people above cars at every turn.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4785728 on 2025-01-13
item.description: Brooklyn-Queens Expressway — A 73-year-old man lost consciousness at the wheel. His Ford SUV veered left, crushing into a Lexus. Belted, chest shattered, he died in his seat. Illness struck first. Steel and speed did the rest.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4770876 on 2024-11-12
item.description: Near 5th Avenue and 39th Street, a motorcycle clipped a sedan pulling into a spot. Metal shrieked. A woman, 52, helmeted, crushed her leg. Northbound traffic. One slowed. One didn’t. The pavement held the silence.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4764626 on 2024-10-17
item.description: Union Street near 9th Avenue — A woman pedaled west. The sign was missed. She flew, struck head-first. Her helmet held. Blood pooled. She stayed awake. The bike was whole. Her body was not. The street stayed silent.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4749410 on 2024-08-19
item.description: Ditmas Avenue near Coney Island Avenue — A box truck turned right. A 16-year-old on a Hurley e-bike was crushed beneath its front. No helmet. No license. His chest gave way. He was thrown. He died there. The truck rolled on, untouched.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4735930 on 2024-06-26
item.description: Corner of Bond and Butler, Brooklyn — An 83-year-old woman, crossing without a signal, was struck by a turning dump truck. The truck showed no damage. Her body bore the weight of steel, silence, and final breath.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4727274 on 2024-05-23
item.description: Corner of 8th Avenue and Union Street — Two sedans collided head-on. Metal folded. A 46-year-old man, unbelted, crushed at the knee. Both drivers distracted. The street fell quiet, holding the weight of what could not be undone.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4720231 on 2024-04-23
item.description: Park Circle and Coney Island Avenue — A 17-year-old boy on a bike, no helmet, struck by an SUV. Thrown hard. Cut deep. His whole body broken. Shock glazed his eyes. Steel front met soft flesh. The pavement held him.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4713401 on 2024-03-29
item.description: Corner of 14th Avenue and 39th Street — A 74-year-old woman stepped into the crosswalk against the light. A northbound Honda SUV struck her head-on. She died there, crushed and broken, her head bleeding on the Brooklyn pavement.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4699806 on 2024-02-03
item.description: Carroll Street near Bond — A Genesis SUV turned left. A moped turned right. The rider, unlicensed and bare, was thrown and crushed. Blood pooled. A leg shattered. The light was ignored. The street did not forgive.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4699808 on 2024-02-03
item.description: Union Street and 6th Avenue — An 83-year-old man crossing with the light. A taxi turns. Steel meets flesh. He falls. Blood pools on the pavement. Head split. Eyes open. The cab did not stop. The street did not forgive.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4691871 on 2024-01-01
item.description: Brooklyn Queens Expressway — A Jeep lost a tire and slammed forward. Metal folded. Seven inside. In the right rear, a man screamed. His leg crushed. He wore a harness. He did not move. The road stayed quiet.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4690798 on 2023-12-28
item.description: Flatbush Avenue at 5th Avenue — A taxi struck a 72-year-old woman crossing against the light. The front end crushed her. She died there, in the dark, alone on the asphalt. By sunrise, the street was still.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4687736 on 2023-12-06
item.description: Ocean Avenue near Parkside — A 90-year-old woman, crossing with the light, struck head-on by a turning sedan. She fell hard. Blood on her face. The car kept moving. She stayed there, conscious, with deep cuts and a wounded head.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4672391 on 2023-10-20
item.description: Sterling Place near 5th Avenue — A 31-year-old man flew from his bike. His arm split open. Blood pooled on the street. An SUV idled, untouched. A passenger turned their head. The crash came from silence, not steel.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4666944 on 2023-10-01
item.description: Flatbush Avenue near 450: An electric sedan slammed a parked Jeep. The unbelted driver flew through the dark. A woman in back, helmeted, was torn at the leg. Both lay bleeding on the street, awake, broken, and still.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4655140 on 2023-08-18
item.description: Corner of Atlantic Avenue and Court Street — Two sedans collided before dawn. Steel screamed. An 18-year-old woman, belted in the front seat, died on impact. Her body stayed still while the city stirred and sirens wailed too late.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4643200 on 2023-06-30
item.description: Caton Avenue near Dahill Road — A 35-year-old man, unlicensed and helmetless, slammed his motorcycle into the side of an SUV. He flew from the bike, struck head-first, and died on the street. The SUV driver was unharmed.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4634151 on 2023-05-31
item.description: Flatbush Avenue near 450: A sedan turned across the lane. A scooter struck hard. The rider flew, hit asphalt. Blood spilled from his leg. No helmet. No gear. Just a man, broken, conscious, bleeding into the morning light.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4624826 on 2023-04-29
item.description: Near 4th Avenue and 6th Street, an e-bike struck a woman in the head. She was not in the road. Blood ran from deep cuts. She stayed conscious. The bike rode on, its front unmarred.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4607398 on 2023-02-17
item.description: Intersection near 621 Hicks Street, Brooklyn — A southbound Lexus struck a 36-year-old man walking with traffic. The sedan’s front crumpled. The man lay bleeding from the head, silent on the asphalt, under the streetlight’s cold glow.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4606313 on 2023-02-12
item.description: Coney Island Avenue near Avenue C — A Toyota’s brakes failed. It plowed into two stopped sedans. Metal crumpled. A 51-year-old man sat belted, his face crushed. Six others waited in silence, the night split by sirens and bent steel.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4581818 on 2022-11-12
item.description: Union Street near 6th Avenue — A Honda SUV plowed into a stopped Kia. In the front seat, a 70-year-old woman cried out. Her back broken. Something gone. She was conscious. Both drivers had looked away.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4580866 on 2022-11-09
item.description: Hicks Street near 509 — A man, 38, slumped dead behind the wheel of a parked 2022 Lexus. Head wound. No seatbelt. Only a child restraint. The car silent. The street colder.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4580944 on 2022-11-09
item.description: Saint Marks Place near 3rd Avenue — A speeding sedan plowed through parked cars. Metal crumpled. A 22-year-old man, unbelted, crushed his arm. Eight records, same name, same wound. The street held the echo of torn steel and pain.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4572613 on 2022-10-12
item.description: Parkside Avenue, near the Flatbush trees — a 25-year-old cyclist struck by a diesel truck while passing. She was thrown, crushed, and killed. Her bike lay twisted. The truck rolled on, untouched. The morning air held no sound.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4567647 on 2022-09-18
item.description: 3rd Avenue near 383rd Street, Brooklyn. A sedan slammed into the back of a parked diesel truck. The driver, 35, cried out—his back broken, pain sharp. He wasn’t thrown. He didn’t move. The report called it “Apparent Death.”

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4561432 on 2022-09-05
item.description: Prospect Park Southwest at Greenwood Avenue — Two bikes collided head-on. A 23-year-old rider hit the ground hard. No helmet. Blood ran from his leg. Skin peeled back. He stayed awake, staring at the sky while the street held its breath.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4543764 on 2022-07-01
item.description: Caton Avenue near East 4th Street, Brooklyn — A 61-year-old man on an e-bike struck the side of a parked Kia. Metal folded. The bike stopped. He did not rise. The street held its breath.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4537823 on 2022-06-15
item.description: Corner of 5th Street and 4th Avenue, Brooklyn — A sedan turned left. A cyclist rode straight. Steel met skin. He flew, face-first to asphalt. Blood pooled. He was 58. He was conscious.

item.title: Council District 39 — Crash 4524747 on 2022-05-04
item.description: Union Street near Clinton, Brooklyn — A taxi struck an eastbound e-scooter. The rider, 40, flew off. No helmet. Blood streamed from his arm. The brakes had failed. He lay conscious on the pavement, staring up at the sky.
